name: 4-hydroxy-2-oxovalerate aldolase
comment: Requires Mn2+ for maximal activity [1]. The enzyme from the bacterium Pseudomonas putida is also stimulated by NADH [1]. In some bacterial species the enzyme forms a bifunctional complex with EC 1.2.1.10, acetaldehyde dehydrogenase (acetylating). The enzymes from the bacteria Burkholderia xenovorans and Thermus thermophilus also perform the reaction of EC 4.1.3.43, 4-hydroxy-2-oxohexanoate aldolase [4,5].

references.title: Crystal structure of a bifunctional aldolase-dehydrogenase: sequestering a reactive and volatile intermediate.
references.journal: Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U. S. A. 100 (2003) 6992-7.
